student_data.notes: Exact enrollment headcounts by major are not listed on public HTML pages, so figures are calculated from the 2023-2024 Common Data Set 'Degrees Conferred' (Section J) and standard program durations. Undergrad: 5.7% of 2,267 total bachelor degrees = ~129 graduates/year; estimated steady-state enrollment 129 * 4 years = 516.8. Masters: 13.9% of 531 total master's degrees = ~74 graduates/year; estimated enrollment 74 * 2 years = 148. PhD: Program exists but confers low number of degrees annually; estimated at ~20 based on department size and typical faculty-to-student ratios for smaller state programs. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes: Primary on-premise cluster is 'Roaring Thunder'. Documentation lists '4 GPU nodes' with 'Dual Nvidia Tesla P100 GPU's'. Calculation: 4 nodes * 2 GPUs = 8 P100 GPUs total. No documentation of newer A100/H100 clusters found on SDSU Research Computing or Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science public pages. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: SDSU (South Dakota State) primarily utilizes the 'Roaring Thunder' cluster. Newer research appears to leverage external resources (National Research Platform/ACCESS) rather than on-premise hardware, as no public specs for local A100/H100 clusters were found.
